snippet: Saying the report was biased and incomplete, Russia hardened its stance even as it pressed ahead with a plan to disarm Syria’s government of its chemical arsenal.
abstract: Russia sharply criticizes United Nations report on Syria’s chemical arms use as biased and incomplete, hardening Kremlin’s defense of Syrian government even while pressing ahead with plan to disarm Syria's arsenal of internationally banned weapons.

byline.original: By STEVEN LEE MYERS and RICK GLADSTONE
byline.contributor: Steven Lee Myers reported from Moscow, and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: Saying the report was biased and incomplete, Russia hardened its stance even as it pressed ahead with a plan to disarm Syria’s government of its chemical arsenal.

headline.main: Russia Calls U.N. Chemical Report on Syria Biased
headline.print_headline: Russia Calls U.N. Chemical Report on Syria Biased
